ARABIC: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ شَاعِرٌ نَّتَرَبَّصُ بِهِۦ رَيْبَ ٱلْمَنُونِ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Or do they say, 'He is a poet and We are waiting for something bad to happen to him'?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Do they say: "He is a poet for whom we expect an adverse turn of fortune?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Or do they say: “He is a poet for whom we await an adverse turn of fortune.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Do they say, "He is only a poet and we are waiting to see him die!?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Or they allege, “He is a poet – we await a calamity of the times to befall him.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Or do they say: "A poet! We await for him some calamity by time!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Or do they say: A poet, we wait for him the evil accidents of time.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Or do they say, 'He is a poet for whom we await Fate's uncertainty'?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Or say they: (he is) a poet, (one) for whom we may expect the accident of time?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: If they say, "He is but a poet; we are waiting for some misfortune to befall him,"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Or say they: a poet for whom we wait some adverse turn of fortune!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Do they say, ‘[He is] a poet, for whom we await a fatal accident’?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Or do they say:- "A Poet! we await for him some calamity (hatched) by Time!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Or do they say: "(Muhammad SAW is) a poet! We await for him some calamity by time!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Or do they say: 'He is a poet, we are waiting for some misfortune to befall him'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Or do they say, “A poet—we await for him a calamity of time”?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Or do they say [of you], "A poet for whom we await a misfortune of time?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [52:30] Or (am means bal) do they say, that he is: ‘A poet, for whom we may await the accidents of fate?’, the vicissitudes of time, so that he will just die like other poets.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Or say they) in fact, the disbelievers of Mecca-Abu Jahl, al-Walid Ibn al-Mughirah and their hosts-say: ((he is) a poet) who invents things, ((one) for whom we may expect the accident of time) we wait to see him suffer the pangs of death?
